page.title: 05Public Footpaths near Ryhill
page.content: The survey area contains many interesting routes for walkers.Two long paths,from Wintersett to Walton and to Crofton,have disappeared under the Anglers Opencast site,but may be reinstated when reclamation is complete.A third connects Havercroft with Foulby,although it skirts Nostell colliery. Several paths pass through the attractive countryside around the two reservoirs and the towpath of the Barnsley canal provides pleasant walking.In Haw Park woods there are sections of two public footpaths and other Forestry Commission permissive paths. There are two attractive bridleways: from Ryhill to Wintersett and to Havercroft.A long stretch of the disused railway from Ryhill to Crofton has been made into a public footpath.
